snippet: The obstruction of Jason Rezaian’s right to counsel has been one of many questions shrouding the Washington Post reporter’s prosecution on undisclosed charges.
abstract: Washington Post Tehran correspondent Jason Rezaian, imprisoned for more than seven months by Iranian authorities on undisclosed charges, is finally allowed legal representation; obstruction of right to lawyer is one of many concerns regarding case beginning with July 2014 arrest of Rezaian and his wife, Iranian journalist Yeganeh Salehi; Leila Ahsan, lawyer who defended Salehi, will represent Rezaian.
lead_paragraph: The obstruction of Jason Rezaian’s right to counsel has been one of many questions shrouding the Washington Post reporter’s prosecution on undisclosed charges.

headline.main: After 7 Months in Jail, U.S. Journalist in Iran Is Allowed to Hire Lawyer
headline.print_headline: Iran: Reporter Allowed to Hire Lawyer
